name: A grande bagunça espacial - The big space mess
description: Hello everyone! Welcome to the craziest adventure of your lives! The fearless Waldisglédson will face creatures from space and find allies on his journey!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 home 64bits or 32bits Graphics: DX9 features (Shader Model 2.0); in general, any board manufactured from 2004 should work. Storage: 2 GB available space Additional Notes: CPU: support for SSE2 instruction set.

reviews.review_text: Horribly low-quality game. The subtitles don't line up, the controls are unintuitive and flighty, and the graphics are awful. The controls deserve especial mention. I press down when navigating the menu, and find my cursor has jumped 2-3 spaces. It's like the dev hasn't even heard of keyboard ramping. Press Enter to... Return to the level select menu? Huh? I accidentally skipped the horribly-paced tutorial and it won't let me return to it without restarting the game. Waste of 59 cents, waste of 18 minutes of my life. Not even going to bother with the cards unless this goes on sale for some embarrassingly low amount. I was expecting something ironically bad, but this is just bad.
Visually probably the ugliest thing on planet earth. If this 'game' was made as a gag, I certainly didn't get it. Idle it, get the cards, then hide it from your games library for eternity.
It's the worst scroll shoter I've played so far - quite an achievement. Don't rely on those reviews, most of them got it for free and they're happy it has cards.

A grande bagunça espacial - The big space mess is a sidescrolling shooter with a story that I can't for the life of me figure out. This game is weird, clunky and just plain stupid  Pros: -Weirdness and Portuguese kind of drew me into trying to figure out what the hell this is -Controls are not too bad  Cons: -The graphics are absolutely terrible, the animations and assets used are horrendous and feels like an early 2000's attempt at 3D graphics -Soundtrack and Sound Effects is awful -Cannot figure the game out and it makes absolutely no sense whatsoever -The 100 achievements for this game makes it even more ridiculous, as there is endless grinding in a pointless game  This game is one of, if not the worst game I have ever played. Stay clear and don't buy 1/10
